description_txt: stated on June 11, 2010:
quote_txt: "Social Security, like I told you, is out of money. This year it is borrowing from the general treasury."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in a debate:
quote_txt: The U.S. spends $4 billion on research and development for energy, while spending $350 billion on oil from foreign countries, "many of whom are our enemies."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in a commentary on MSNBC's "The Ed Show":
quote_txt: With his decision on whether to fire Gen. Stanley McChrystal, President Obama "has to fix yet another problem he inherited from the Bush administration."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2010 in ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "If the Republicans were the majority, (Rep. Barton) would have actually the gavel and the chairmanship."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: Under President George W. Bush, "the national debt went from $5 trillion to $12 trillion."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Bill McCollum "served as a lobbyist whose clients enabled mortgages for illegal immigrants."

description_txt: stated on June 10, 2010 in an op-ed. :
quote_txt: "Health reform eliminates co-pays, deductibles, and other costs for preventative care and provides for free annual wellness checkups starting next year."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in a Democratic U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: Jeff Greene "is the king of the undercover Credit Default Swap that brought about the destruction of our economy that we have right now."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in in a Democratic U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: "When I become the nominee, the Democratic nominee, I will be the only pro-choice candidate on the ballot."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2010 in an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: "We only have 2 percent of the oil reserves in the world, and we consume 25 percent of the world's oil on a daily basis."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2010 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: "For six years, I served our community as a conservative state legislator. In every one of those years, I helped balance the state's budget."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2010 in an interview on "This Week.":
quote_txt: "In the case of General Motors, the (Bush) administration wrote a check without asking for any conditions of change."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Rick Scott “has heavily invested in a company that is geared to helping illegal aliens transfer money to family and friends out of the country."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2010 in a video promo for "Jersey Shore":
quote_txt: "Obama put a 10 percent tax on tanning."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2010 in an interview on the Fox Business network:
quote_txt: "We get 30 percent of our oil from the Gulf (of Mexico)."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2010 in a campaign flier:
quote_txt: "Rob Teilhet, Just another career politician."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2010 in a speech at the Texas Republican Party Convention:
quote_txt: "We have a director of homeland security who cannot use and will not use the term 'terrorist attack' but instead substitutes 'man-made disaster.' "

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2010 in a campaign flier:
quote_txt: Georgia Secretary of State Brian Kemp is a "career politician."

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: U.S. Rep. Lloyd Doggett is “the most liberal man in the United States Congress.”

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: “The Republican Party lost 1.1 million registered voters since 2008. The Democratic Party lost 1.2 million registered voters… (while) voter registration in the Libertarian Party rose 8 percent.”

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2010 in a brochure :
quote_txt: The addition of a 1 percent sales tax would cost a typical household in Hillsborough County approximately $12 a month.

description_txt: stated on May 26, 2010 in an interview on FOX.:
quote_txt: "On the pace that we're on with job creation in the last four months ... we will have created more jobs in this year than in the entire Bush Presidency."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2010 in a political ad:
quote_txt: "Without representation, (the IRS) can increase taxes."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Phoenix, Arizona, I'm told, is now the No. 2 kidnapping capital in the world, right behind Mexico City."

description_txt: stated on June 10, 2010 in a video:
quote_txt: Thurbert Baker kept a teen in jail "who didn't even commit a felony."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in a speech from the Oval Office:
quote_txt: "Oil companies showered regulators (at the Minerals Management Service) with gifts and favors, and were essentially allowed to conduct their own safety inspections and write their own regulations."

description_txt: stated on May 26, 2010 in YouTube video of a floor speech:
quote_txt: "Ninety-four percent of the bills that pass the Senate have no debate, no vote, no amendments, no reading of the bill, no online disclosure."

description_txt: stated on June 10, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: "The minute this proposal for near-beach oil drilling came up, I was against it."

description_txt: stated on June 3, 2010 in a CBS4 interview:
quote_txt: "If you read the Arizona (immigration) law, what it says is if you are stopped for violating the law and they have a suspicion that you're illegal, they can ask you if you're legal."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2010 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: Says the Republican “state convention is actually larger than the Republican National Convention.”
